titleStmt.title: A collection of paintings & limnings by the best masters, &c. will be sold by auction on Friday the 7th, and Saturday the 8th of this instant February, 1689/90. at the Barbadoes Coffee-House in Exchange-Alley, over against the Royal-Exchange, in Cornhil The sale beginning precisely at four of the clock each afternoon. Catalogues of which are destributed by Mr. Gilliflower in Westminster-Hall: Mr. Nott in the Pall Mall: Mr. Bently in Russel-street, Covent-Garden: Mr. Wilkinson in Fleet-street: Mr. Hargrave, at the King's-Head, over against Furnivals-Inn in Holborn: Mr. Miller, at the Acorn, in St. Paul's Church-yard: and Mr. Crouch over against the Royal-Exchange, in Cornhil, bookselles [sic]. The conditions of sale as usual, and the time of paying and fetching away the lots so bought, to be within three days after it, at the said place.

A collection of paintings & limnings by the best masters, &c. will be sold by auction on Friday the 7th, and Saturday the 8th of this instant February, 1689/90. at the Barbadoes Coffee-House in Exchange-Alley, over against the Royal-Exchange, in Cornhil The sale beginning precisely at four of the clock each afternoon. Catalogues of which are destributed by Mr. Gilliflower in Westminster-Hall: Mr. Nott in the Pall Mall: Mr. Bently in Russel-street, Covent-Garden: Mr. Wilkinson in Fleet-street: Mr. Hargrave, at the King's-Head, over against Furnivals-Inn in Holborn: Mr. Miller, at the Acorn, in St. Paul's Church-yard: and Mr. Crouch over against the Royal-Exchange, in Cornhil, bookselles [sic]. The conditions of sale as usual, and the time of paying and fetching away the lots so bought, to be within three days after it, at the said place.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
